definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.chinese: 克里姆林宫的圣母领报大教堂。

sentences.english: Mr Nogaideli claims that the Kremlin is backsliding[5].
sentences.chinese: 诺盖杰利声称是克里姆林宫背信弃义的。

sentences.english: Troops line up at one of the gates to the Kremlin.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在通往克里姆林宫的一个大门前整队。

sentences.english: Obama's decision will stimulate thinking in the multipolar world within the Kremlin.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的决定将会刺激克里姆林宫对多极世界的思考。

sentences.english: He didn't recognizance Russia that Kremlin-controlled television showed.
sentences.chinese: 他不承认克里姆林宫所掌控着的电视媒体下的俄罗斯。

sentences.english: In April the Kremlin cancelled its counter-terrorist regime in Chechnya.
sentences.chinese: 今年4月，克里姆林宫取消了在车臣的官方反恐机构。

sentences.english: Is the Kremlin turning dovish in its most recent confrontation with the West?
sentences.chinese: 在最近与西方的对峙中，克里姆林宫要变鸽派了？

sentences.english: Kremlin- controlled media outlets have presented an image of unity in the leadership.
sentences.chinese: 克里姆林宫控制的媒体一直宣传领导层的团结形象。

sentences.english: The Kremlin may be calculating that a stepped-up military is in Moscow's interest.
sentences.chinese: 克里姆林宫可能认为加强军队符合莫斯科的利益。

sentences.english: But these days the Kremlin's chums are mostvisible on the populist right.
sentences.chinese: 而如今克里姆林宫的密友多属于民粹派。

definition: Sochi (city on the Black Sea in Russia)
Medvedyev (name)/Dmitry Anatolyevich Medvedev (1965-), Russian lawyer and politician, president of Russian Federation from 2008
Kaliningrad, town on Baltic now in Russian republic/formerly Königsberg, capital of East Prussia
Yekaterinburg (Russian city, also known as Ekaterinburg or Sverdlovsk)
Russia/Russian/abbr. for 俄羅斯|俄罗斯[E2 luo2 si1]/Taiwan pr. [E4]
Volgograd, Russian city on the Volga River 伏爾加河|伏尔加河[Fu2 er3 jia1 He2]
Lavrov (name)/Sergey Viktorovich Lavrov (1950-), Russian diplomat and politician, Foreign minister from 2004
